alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 2:09AM MST until July 28 at 3:15AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHERN COCONINO COUNTY FROM ANTELOPE CANYON TO GRAND CANYON... At 207 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated mainly light rain from Antelope Canyon east of Page to near Bitter Springs, to the northeast portion of Grand Canyon National Park. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain fell earlier. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bitter Springs, LeChee, Antelope Creek Basin, Antelope Canyon Near Sr 98, Grand Canyon National Park, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Waterholes Canyon, Antelope Canyon and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 515 and 542. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 524 and 537...and between mile markers 542 and 557. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Tiger Wash, South Canyon, Shinumo Wash, Kaibito Creek, North Canyon Wash, Jackass Creek, Tatahoysa Wash, Leche-e Wash, Sand Wash, Badger Canyon, Peach Wash, House Rock Wash, Colorado River, Tatahatso Wash, Soap Creek, Fall Creek, Curve Wash, Antelope Creek, South Fork Soap Creek, Sheep Wash, Hogansaani Wash, Tanner Wash, Bekihatso Wash and Emmett Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Enhanced risk for violent, life-threatening flash flooding in slot canyons and normally dry washes.Flash floods can come from distant thunderstorms, even with little or no rainfall in the immediate area.
